instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no power on
threads.message:
Board was little liquide damage <CHIP>U5400</CHIP> area and <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> area <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> fine. other area very clean 

First I have pin 6, 5 of <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> pulse, tried flash with good rom know 2936-B board (I've backup original rom), voltage after flash was good, after tried with original bios clean me and voltage stable.

Noticed, see Fan pulse after plug charger 1 time and cpu heat, no chime.

see screenshot liquid area

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no power on
threads.message: The usual corrosion issues: crap under SMC, bad clock chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no power on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no power on
threads.message: That is fine, there would be PPBUS issues if not.
